# AxisDirectionConvention.rightUpForward

**Case**

The convention that uses a clockwise winding order and positions the leading pixel at the top-left corner of the view.

## Declaration

```swift
case rightUpForward
```

## Discussion

This convention positions the left-most pixel at the left edge of the view and the top-most pixel at the top edge of the view, and the system renders with a clockwise winding order.

## Getting the axis directions

- **AxisDirectionConvention.rightUpBack**: The convention that uses a counterclockwise winding order and positions the leading pixel at the top-left corner of the view.
- **AxisDirectionConvention.rightDownBack**: The convention that uses a counterclockwise winding order and positions the leading pixel at the bottom-left corner of the view.
- **AxisDirectionConvention.rightDownForward**: The convention that uses a clockwise winding order and positions the leading pixel at the bottom-left corner of the view.
